author: Corky Emrick
title: Conference volleyball matchups
text: By Corky Emrick Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 11:09 PM Three Rivers had their Wolverine Conference record fall to 3-5 with a 25-18, 28-26, 25-21 loss to Vicksburg Thursday night. “We played with intensity, but Vicksburg’s defense is really stout,” coach Erik Kore said. “It was hard to put the ball away.” Megan Southland had 13 kills and 18 digs, Zoey Wilson had nine kills and Shelby Krawcak had seven kills. Tessa Hawkins led with 25 digs and Morgan Schneider had 10. Hawkins also led the Lady Cats with three aces and Maya Bidelman had 29 assists. White Pigeon hosts tri White Pigeon hosted a tri meet with Michigan Lutheran and Grace Christian. Results were not reported. Howardsville Christian quad Centreville allowed just 34 points through six games, sweeping Country Side Christian 25-5, 25-7, 25-2 and Howardsville Christian 25-9, 25-9, 25-1 Thursday night. Hannah Marchand had 17 kills, 19 digs and two aces, Carlee Odom had eight aces, two kills, five digs and one assist,Bailee May had 15 aces, nine kills, 11 digs, one block and one assist and Madison Hunter added 15 assists, eight digs, six kills and two aces. Sara Lewis had nine digs and one kill, Kayla Gest added five digs and three kills, Skyler DeMeyer had 18 aces, 17 assists and four kills, Kalee Schrock had nine digs, three kills and three aces and Hannah Rice added six aces, three digs and two kills. Andrea Bell had four kills and one dig. Falcons sweep Constantine defeated Bloomingdale 25-9, 25-11 and Martin 25-19, 28-26 as host of a SACquad Thursday. “The girls played consistent tonight, they passed great out of serve/receive and our hitter put down tough balls to defend,” coach Niki Tulley said. “Bailey Potter had 36 assists, five digs and one kill, Mackenzi Dobosiewicz had 12 kills and 14 digs, Macey Tulley added 10 kills, six digs and one block, Hannah Ley had eight kills and two digs and Rachel Corpe had 13 digs. Ashley Loose had 10 digs and Paulina Diaz added three kills. Hillsdale 25, 25, 25, 25 Burr Oak 10, 18, 14, 23 Hillsdale Academy swept Burr Oak in a doubleheader 25-10, 25-18, 25-14, 25-23 Thursday night. Brooke Cooper had 11 digs, six assists, four kills and one block, Abby Greene had one dig, Chelsey Boyd added 18 digs, four kills and two aces and Hannah Root had two digs. Ivy Eels added two kills and one dig, Kaitlin Cooper had 15 digs and added one ace and one kill, Lexi Habib had 21digs, four kills and one ace, Sydney Owens added three kills, five assists and four digs and Zoe Lewis had two digs, one ace and one assist. Gobles Triad Marcellus picked up two more wins Thursday night defeating hartford 30-28, 25-6 and Gobles 25-14, 25-23 at a SACtri meet hosted by Gobles. Page 2 of 2 - Rochelle Zachrich had 21 digs, two aces and one kill, Mackenzie Buck had two kills, two blocks and two digs, Elena Gemello added 21 digs, seven assists, five kills and five aces and Helis Sala had 20 kills, seven digs, two aces and one block. Madison Fisher had 31 assists, 19 digs, two kills and two blocks, Grace Mihills added eight kills, five digs and three blocks, Jade Sibley had 10 digs, and Aleyna Hutson had 14 kills and 22 digs. Sturgis swept The Sturgis volleyball team ended the conference season with a loss to Edwardsburg 22-25, 17-25 and 19-25 on Thursday. “Many improvements were made tonight by the Trojans, in the end we just fell short each time,”Sturgis coachJacki Veldkamp said. Sturgis got six kills fromPaige Robinson, four each from Nikki Nelson, Camryn Hamlin and Brianna Wheeler. Nelson led with four blocks, Hamlin and Paige Andrews each added two. Wheeler handed out 17 assists, Andrews had five. Morgan Pueschel logged 19 digs, Harmony Groves had 11 and Wheeler added nine. Rachel Huff and Andrews each had seven.
